sentence.content: While Lt. Guy Zanti&apost;s wife and father run a marathon today in Washington, the naval officer intends to match their efforts on the battleship Wisconsin in the waters of the Middle East.

sentence.content: Zanti became interested in marathon running in April when he watched his 53-year-old father run his first marathon in California.

sentence.content: Zanti told his father that even if he couldn&apost;t make it to today&apost;s Marine Corps Marathon, he would still run the 26.2 miles.

sentence.content: "He had been based in the Mediterranean, so he planned on training on land and the ship, and then running the marathon on land," said his father, Frank Zanti.

sentence.content: The Wisconsin is 887 feet long, about one-sixth of a mile; the 29-year-old Zanti will have to make about 75 laps.
